summary: The concept of "helicopter" falls under the category of air and space transport within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. Helicopters are subject to specific regulations concerning airworthiness, safety standards, and operational licensing, which are essential for ensuring compliance with EU aviation law. The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) plays a pivotal role in overseeing these regulations, ensuring that helicopter operations meet stringent safety and environmental criteria. Furthermore, helicopters are integral to various sectors, including emergency services and transport logistics, necessitating a robust regulatory framework to facilitate their safe and efficient integration into the broader air transport system.
